ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Upsetting thoughts or memories about the event that have come into your mind against your will
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Upsetting dreams about the event
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Acting or feeling as though the event were happening again
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Feeling upset by reminders of the event

Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Bodily reactions (such as fast heartbeat, stomach churning, sweatiness, dizziness) when reminded of the event
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Difficulty falling or staying asleep
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Irritability or outbursts of anger
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Difficulty concentrating
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Heightened awareness of potential dangers to yourself and others
Please indicate whether or not you have experienced the following at least twice in the past week: Being jumpy or being startled at something unexpected
